title: Unable to Log in because you're offline
body:
I'm unable to log in and I keep getting the error message "unable to log in because you're offline". My internet connection is fine. I tried editing the Leagueclientsettings.yaml in the league files (I saw a rioter recommend this on another discussion post for the same issue)

So, I uninstalled league. When I try to reinstall and select North America, windows, the page does not respond. 
What do I do? I have google fiber if that helps.

replies.body: There might be a setting, firewall, or antivirus that's blocking your network from reaching the authentication server and assumes you're offline.  Try out the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as well as auto-configuring firewall settings with our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to help resolve this.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aPUFVK3d,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-27T17:27:03.973+0000)
>
> There might be a setting, firewall, or antivirus that's blocking your network from reaching the authentication server and assumes you're offline.  Try out the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide as well as auto-configuring firewall settings with our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to help resolve this.

The issue is with Google Fiber and their DNS server. After troubleshooting for a while it seems that the best fix is to switch to Verisign's Public DNS server which is 64.6.64.6 and 64.6.65.6 for the alternate. This has been the only solution thus far for anyone else having these issues.

Thanks for the suggestion, but unfortunately that did not work either :(

EDIT: WOW JK IT WORKED. Thanks! It didn't work immediately, so I restarted my internet and computer and bam.

> [{quoted}](name=Meowpai,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aPUFVK3d,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2017-10-28T02:06:52.556+0000)
>
> Thanks for the suggestion, but unfortunately that did not work either :(

Make sure you close the client before you change it, and make sure you are changing the right adapter's DNS. After you change it then open the client and see if the issue persists.

Edit: Awesome! Glad I could help out!

Oh boy oh boy. Well, I was able to log on and *almost* get a game going, but unfortunately got kicked out. Now I cannot log on anymore.
Still really appreciate your help though! 
Looks like I'll have to wait for google fiber to get their shit together lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Meowpai,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=aPUFVK3d,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-28T02:25:13.519+0000)
>
> Oh boy oh boy. Well, I was able to log on and *almost* get a game going, but unfortunately got kicked out. Now I cannot log on anymore.
> Still really appreciate your help though! 
> Looks like I'll have to wait for google fiber to get their shit together lol.

Make sure you didn't reset your adapter, since when you reset the computer it can change your DNS configuration to "Obtain a DNS server automatically" (With windows) which will go back to a Google DNS since it's their network. It then needs to be set back to the public DNS. Also turn off IPv6 in the properties to avoid any IPv6 connections. If it is using that public DNS and not trying to automatically get another one from Google Fiber, and you have IPv6 turned off then there might be some other issue with Google Fiber beyond the DNS. Hopefully this works for you.
Ayyy I am able to play using these settings now. Thanks you're the best.
Finally a solution! Thank you for all your help {{champion:17}}

Chatted with player support and google fiber. Apparently google fiber is blocking access to league.
Thanks for the help tho porocles <3
Wat? That's really strange to hear.  I don't have enough context on this, but I'll reach out to our tech guys to see why this would be a thing.
They're not really blocking access but they're just having trouble with league recently. They had me run a trace route and they said they'd look into where it failed.

Here's a solution I tried that has seen some success.  Add "23.74.24.114 l3cdn.riotgames.com" to your C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc "hosts" file at the bottom line.  That should be able to allow you to login.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
This worked for me as well. Using openDNS over google's also worked, but this solution seems easier.

I have the same problem myself, Ill give u a temporary solution, use your cellphone as a hotspot and login the game, get in the lobby and select ur role, then switch back to google fiber and start queing, is a lil bit trouble but u can play foso. I also contacted gf and got a ticket put together
